title.narrative: “Promoting the Culture of Peace and Sustainability in Myanmar” Phase IV

description.narrative:
Based on a "personal to societal transformational approach" SEM is planning to continue to respond to the needs of a changing context in Myanmar under the military coup. SEM will extend some of their targeted geographic area and groups of people, expanding to other religious, ethnic and activist groups. The main aim of this phase will be to build strong networks of individuals and groups as well as to contribute to the formation of resilient communities amidst the ongoing violence and humanitarian crisis. SEM will continue intra and inter groups dialogues and accompaniment with some capacity building activities facilitating among cross cutting issues such as understanding political dynamics, people’s identity perceptions and alternative community development and education. Dialogue will continue to be the foundation of all interventions with follow up initiatives and support to those targeted participants for their personal development as well as community activities.
For the first year of the project SEM will target 70 people including existing alumni and new participants. By years 2 and 3 based on the first year experience it will plan to add 100 more. At the same time, SEM will expand to ongoing research and network establishment in both Myanmar and Thailand. These in order to develop sustainable frameworks in which targeted participants can interact and lead beyond short term-humanitarian type interventions. For this new phase activities and interventions will take place in both sides of the border.
